info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 9:02PM EDT until June 27 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
FFWFFC
The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Cherokee County in north central Georgia... Cobb County in north central Georgia... North Central Fulton County in north central Georgia... Southeastern Bartow County in northwestern Georgia... Northeastern Paulding County in northwestern Georgia...
* Until 1145 PM EDT.
* At 902 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Atlanta, Marietta, Cartersville, Mountain Park, City of South Fulton, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Powder Springs, Austell, Emerson, Fair Oaks, Kennesaw State University, White Water Park and Sandy Plains.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Bartow, GA; Cherokee, GA; Cobb, GA; Fulton, GA; Paulding, GA
